title: Hello, Quarto
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Hello, Quarto
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Hello, Quarto
text:
Meet the penguins

The penguins data from the palmerpenguins package contains size measurements for 344 penguins from three species observed on three islands in the Palmer Archipelago, Antarctica.
The plot below shows the relationship between flipper and bill lengths of these penguins.

title: Hello, Quarto
text:
code chuk

a <- 1


a <- 2


print(a)

[1] 1

text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Untitled
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: Untitled
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Overview
text:
Column

Column 2









이렇게 나눠서 하려면
.incremental
로 구분




.nonincremental
는 미리 나와있음.
모든 슬라이드에 적용: YAML에 (권장하지 않음)





여러개를
나눠서




나오게 하려면
.fragment








슬라이드 내용

:::{.notes}
발표자 노트 내용 (S키로)
:::

발표자 노트 내용





이 내용에 주석을 달고 싶으면
이렇게도 1
달 수 있음 2



이렇게 달 수 있습니다.






{.r code-line-numbers='4-6'}

#| eval: false
#| echo: true
iris %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')


library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
iris %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')










#| fig-width: 3

fig-width: 3


library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
iris %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')






fig-width: 6


library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
iris %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')










#| fig-height: 4

fig-height: 4


library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)
iris %>% 
  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) + 
  geom_point() + 
  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')






fig-height: 8


library(ggplot2)
library(magrittr)

  ggplot(
    aes(
      x = Sepal.Length, 
      y = Sepal.Width, 
      color = Species
    )
  ) +

  theme(legend.position = 'bottom')
